noun.description: Originally: pathological fear of being or becoming physically deformed. Later: specifically = "body dysmorphic disorder".

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in William Dorland (1864–1956), obstetrician. From ancient Greek δύσμορϕος misshapen (from δυσ- + -μορϕος) + -phobia, after Italian dismorfofobia.
